intro: Psychotria bathieana, commonly known as the Bathieana Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid and warm climates. The plant has been studied for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its ecological role remains under investigation.
